structured_data.professional_summary: Data Scientist with 3 years of experience and a Master’s degree in Data Science - Computational Linguistics from The University of British Columbia. Skilled in developing data applications using machine learning and Large Language Models. Proven ability to lead end-to-end projects, from conceptualization to deployment. Expertise in designing and implementing ETL pipelines and building data warehouse infrastructure. Experienced in developing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) solutions and fine-tuning Large Language Models. Strong background in fast-paced startup environments.

experience.responsibilities: Developed Iranian Newspaper Research Assistant, an application that makes previously non-searchable scanned historical newspaper and document archives searchable through Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG). Collected and converted scanned archives into machine-readable text, improving accessibility for researchers and historians. Implemented full-text and semantic search, enabling intuitive document retrieval. Developed graph-based search, allowing users to explore relationships between documents through graph visualizations. Built a chatbot-style assistant for intuitive natural language queries, allowing easy exploration of the archives.

Developed a custom Agentic Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) solution from scratch, providing users with reliable and vetted data, advanced analytics, and visualizations via an intuitive chatbot interface. Fine-tuned Large Language Models to improve performance in semantic search, question answering, and function calling. Built web scraping tools, automating large-scale data collection from 50+ sources.

Sole data scientist responsible for designing and building a data warehouse, reducing reporting time by 70%. Designed and orchestrated scalable ETL pipelines integrating data from 11+ sources. Delivered actionable insights through connected dashboards for marketing, finance, and operations teams.

Developed a new semantic search system for BC Data Catalogue, improving search precision by 25% and recall by 40%. Developed topic modeling solution, providing users with interactive visualizations, improving BC Data Catalogue’s user experience. Received two awards for project presentation and was featured on the UBC website.
Automated data scraping pipelines to extract structured and unstructured data from 40+ sources. Developed and optimized ETL pipelines, improving data processing efficiency by 20%.

years_exp: 3 years of experience in Data Science
profile:
Behrooz Qiassi is a highly skilled Data Scientist with three years of experience and a Master’s degree in Data Science - Computational Linguistics from the University of British Columbia. With a strong foundation in machine learning and Large Language Models (LLMs), he excels at developing innovative data-driven applications and delivering impactful solutions. Behrooz has a proven track record of leading end-to-end projects, designing ETL pipelines, and building robust data warehouse infrastructures, all while thriving in fast-paced startup environments.

In his current role as an Independent Data Scientist, Behrooz developed the Iranian Newspaper Research Assistant, a groundbreaking application leveraging Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to make scanned historical archives searchable and accessible. Previously, he designed a custom Agentic RAG solution at Nu Data, integrating advanced analytics and chatbot interfaces, and spearheaded a data warehouse initiative at XYON Health, reducing reporting time by 70%. His expertise in semantic search, graph-based visualizations, and AI chatbot development has consistently delivered measurable results, earning him awards and recognition from esteemed organizations like BC Stats and UBC.

Behrooz possesses a versatile technical skill set, including Python, SQL, PostgreSQL, AWS, Pytorch, and LangChain, among others. He has also demonstrated proficiency in building intuitive dashboards, fine-tuning LLMs, and orchestrating scalable data pipelines. Recognized for his ability to create meaningful insights and improve user experiences, Behrooz is a dynamic professional dedicated to pushing the boundaries of data science and computational linguistics.

responsibilities: Developed an application to make scanned Iranian historical newspapers searchable through Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
Converted scanned archives into machine-readable text, improving accessibility for researchers and historians.
Implemented full-text and semantic search, enabling efficient and intuitive document retrieval.
Created graph-based search to explore document relationships through interactive graph visualizations.
Built a chatbot assistant for natural language queries, simplifying archive exploration for users.
Developed a custom Agentic Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) solution providing advanced analytics via a chatbot interface.
Fine-tuned Large Language Models to enhance semantic search, question answering, and function calling capabilities.
Built automated web scraping tools for large-scale data collection from over 50 sources.
Designed and built a data warehouse as the sole data scientist, reducing reporting time by 70%.
Created scalable ETL pipelines to integrate data from over 11 sources for unified data processing.
Delivered actionable insights through connected dashboards for marketing, finance, and operations teams.
Improved BC Data Catalogue's search precision by 25% and recall by 40% with a new semantic search system.
Developed topic modeling solutions with interactive visualizations to enhance user experience.
Received two awards for project presentation and featured recognition on the UBC website.
Automated data scraping pipelines for extracting structured and unstructured data from more than 40 sources.
Optimized ETL pipelines, increasing data processing efficiency by 20%.
